Class: Socket

Socket

Socket

new Socket()

Socket is a web socket module acting as the primary server for all the game related services. There are some events that can be fired before a game is started, such as player and room related events.
Source:
  • Socket.js, line 13
Returns:
Socket The wev socket is designed specifically for ProjectNaN, and utilizes socket.io for simplicity purposes.

Methods

getFile(filename) → {string|undefined}

Parameters:
Name Type Description
filename string filename is a string of a requested file using socket.io as the medium.
Source:
  • Socket.js, line 210
Returns:
contents of the requested file, otherwise returns undefined if the files doesn't exist
Type
string | undefined

initialize(webService, gameServer)

The initialize method in the Socket module is similar any other module in the pack. It is to set up data and methods needed during runtime. In this instance a new socket is created to manage websocket messages. For each connection to the server a series of events are defined to manage the menu, game server rooms, and mics statistics.
Parameters:
Name Type Description
webService http Used to source infomation from the http web service setup previously in execution.
gameServer game Enables the socket to utilize the game module when events are fired.
Source:
  • Socket.js, line 40
